sen.j: 鷹司 教平（たかつかさ のりひら、慶長14年1月10日 (旧暦)（1609年2月14日） - 寛文8年10月3日 (旧暦)（1668年11月7日））は江戸時代の公卿。
sen.e: Norihira TAKATSUKASA (February 14, 1609 - November 7, 1668) was kugyo (high court noble) in the Edo period.
Norihira TAKATSUKASA (February 14, 1609 - November 7, 1668) was a Court noble who lived during the Edo period.
sen.cmt: 公卿を Court nobleとし、また 用語統一の「レビュー結果」（2009/7/31）に従い、inの部分を who lived duringに修正致しました。
sen.e: Norihira TAKATSUKASA (February 14, 1609 - November 7, 1668) was a Court noble who lived during the Edo period.
His father was Nobuhisa TAKATSUKASA.
His father was Nobuhisa TAKATSUKASA.
His father was Nobuhisa TAKATSUKASA.

sen.j: 母は後陽成天皇第三皇女清子内親王 (江戸時代)。
sen.e: His mother was Princess Sugako, the third daughter of Emperor Goyozei (the Edo period).
His mother was Princess Sugako, the third daughter of Emperor Goyozei (the Edo period).
His mother was Princess Sugako, the third daughter of Emperor Goyozei (the Edo period).
His lawful wife was Princess Bunchi.
His lawful wife was Princess Bunchi.
His lawful wife was Princess Bunchi.

sen.j: 側室に冷泉為満の娘がいる。
sen.e: Tamemitsu REIZEI's daughter was his concubine.
Tamemitsu REIZEI's daughter was his concubine.
Tamemitsu REIZEI's daughter was his concubine.

sen.j: 子に鷹司房輔、九条兼晴、鷹司信子（徳川綱吉正室）、鷹司房子（霊元天皇の中宮）、俊海（九条兼晴猶子）らがいる。
sen.e: He had children including Fusasuke TAKATSUKASA, Kaneharu KUJO, Nobuko TAKATSUKASA (lawful wife of Tsunayoshi TOKUGAWA), Fusako TAKATSUKASA (second consort of Emperor Reigen), and Shunkai (adopted by Kaneharu KUJO).
sen.cmt: 「九条兼晴」の読み方は<http://kotobank.jp/word/%E4%B9%9D%E6%9D%A1%E5%85%BC%E6%99%B4>を参照
sen.e: He children included Fusasuke TAKATSUKASA, Kaneharu KUJO, Nobuko TAKATSUKASA (lawful wife of Tsunayoshi TOKUGAWA), Fusako TAKATSUKASA (second consort of Emperor Reigen), and Shunkai (adopted by Kaneharu KUJO).
sen.cmt: 文頭の表現を修正致しました。
sen.e: He children included Fusasuke TAKATSUKASA, Kaneharu KUJO, Nobuko TAKATSUKASA (lawful wife of Tsunayoshi TOKUGAWA), Fusako TAKATSUKASA (second consort of Emperor Reigen), and Shunkai (adopted by Kaneharu KUJO).
His alias was Icchiin (一致院).
He called himself Icchiin (一致院).
He called himself Icchiin (一致院).
His one character names were Un (雲), Ken (謙), and Ko (公).
Un (雲), Ken (謙), and Ko (公) were his names which were written in one character.
sen.cmt: Rewrote the sentence because I felt that 'one charater name' for the translation of '一字名' needed more explanation for the non-native readers.
sen.e: His one character names were Un (雲), Ken (謙), and Ko (公).
sen.cmt: 翻訳者の訳に戻しました。（過去の翻訳例から）

sen.e: He was Dainagon (Major Counselor) and served in Konoefu (the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards).
He held the post of Dainagon (Major Counselor) and served in Konoefu (the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards).
sen.cmt: post ofを追記致しました。
sen.e: He held the post of Dainagon (Major Counselor) and served in Konoefu (the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards).

sen.j: 従一位（1655年（承応4年）1月29日 (旧暦)叙）。
sen.e: He was appointed to Juichii (Junior First Rank) on January 29, 1655 (the old calendar).
He rose to the rank of Juichii (Junior First Rank) on March 7, 1655.
sen.cmt: 位が上がったため rose to に変え、日付を新暦に修正致しました。
sen.e: He rose to the rank of Juichii (Junior First Rank) on March 7, 1655.

sen.j: 慶長14年（1609年）に鷹司信尚の子として生まれる。
sen.e: He was born to Nobuhisa TAKATSUKASA in 1609.
He was born to Nobuhisa TAKATSUKASA in 1609.
He was born to Nobuhisa TAKATSUKASA in 1609.
He held various posts such as Naidaijin (Minister of the Center) (1632), Udaijin (Minister of the Right) (1632 - 1640) and Sadaijin (Minister of the Left) (1640 - 1641).
He held various posts such as Naidaijin (Minister of the Center) (1632), Udaijin (Minister of the Right) (1632 - 1640), and Sadaijin (Minister of the Left) (1640 - 1641).
sen.cmt: and Sadaijinの前に,(カンマ)を追記致しました。
sen.e: He held various posts such as Naidaijin (Minister of the Center) (1632), Udaijin (Minister of the Right) (1632 - 1640), and Sadaijin (Minister of the Left) (1640 - 1641).
He died in 1668.
He died in 1668.
He died in 1668.

sen.j: なお、18世紀初期には近衛家以外の摂関家の全ての当主が教平の男系の孫（鷹司兼熙・一条兼香・九条輔実・二条綱平）が占めていた時期がある。
sen.e: At one time in the early 18 century, all the heads of Sekkan-ke (the families which produced the Regent and the Chief Adviser to the Emperor) other than the Konoe family were took over by Norihira's grandsons (Kanehiro TAKATSUKASA, Kaneka ICHIJO, Kaneyoshi KUJO or also called Kaneka KUJO and Tsunahira NIJO) through a line of males.

At one time during the early 18th century, with the exception of the Konoe family, all the heads of Sekkan-ke (the families which produced the Regent and the Chief Adviser to the Emperor) were taken up by Norihira's grandsons (Kanehiro TAKATSUKASA, Kaneka ICHIJO, Sukeie KUJO, and Tsunahira NIJO).
sen.cmt: 男系の孫＝grandsonとして訳出されていたため、文末のthrough a line of malesを削除致しました。また一部時制を修正致しました。
sen.e: At one time during the early 18th century, with the exception of the Konoe family, all the heads of Sekkan-ke (the families which produced the Regent and the Chief Adviser to the Emperor) were taken up by Norihira's grandsons (Kanehiro TAKATSUKASA, Kaneka ICHIJO, Sukeie KUJO, and Tsunahira NIJO).
